text:
Quincke's edema, revisited.
 Angioneurotic edema involving the uvula is sometimes referred to as Quincke's edema.
 The term angioneurotic edema describes several closely related diseases manifested by recurrent, acute edema of the skin or mucosa.
 We report a case of uvular edema secondary to food allergy, treated successfully with steroids.
 A short review of angioneurotic edema and its management is also presented.
